page.title: 05Ecology continued
page.content: rutting season. Herds are culled to maintain a healthy population. Foxes,badgers, squirrel and rabbits about along with mice, voles, shrews etc plus occasional unwelcome mink. Bats and adders have been seen too. Butterfly population about usual for aera of mixed woodlalnd. Most of the surrounding farmland is under grass with sheep and cattle grazing and a few horses. Once the ponds and streams supplied the local people wit an important source of food fish and bird life were plentiful. Pollution has reduced the fish population. Some ponds dry out in summer, and in others the aquatic life is less than healthy. Good news is that anglers have done a lot of good work in tending the ponds, which in turn improve plant, animal and fish life and birds too.
